dsurround.command.dump.success: Dump of %1$s §2succeeded§r.  Data can be found in %2$s
dsurround.command.reload.success: Resources reload §2succeeded§r. Examine log for details.
dsurround.command.reload.failure: Resources reload §4failed§r.  Examine log for details.
dsurround.config.title: §6Dynamic Surroundings§r Configuration Options
dsurround.config.logging.tooltip: Configuration options for modifying logging behavior
dsurround.config.logging.enableDebugLogg: Enables/disables debug logging of the mod
dsurround.config.logging.traceMask.toolt: Bitmask for toggling various debug traces
dsurround.config.logging.enableModUpdate: Enable/disable chat window notification of newer updates available
dsurround.config.soundSystem.tooltip: Configuration options for modifying Minecraft's Sound System behavior
dsurround.config.soundSystem.streamingCh: The number of sound channels to reserve for streaming sounds (music, biome sounds, records, etc.)
dsurround.config.soundSystem.cullInterva: Ticks between culled sound events (0 to disable culling)
dsurround.config.soundSystem.enableSound: Enables/disables cancellation of sound that a player will not hear.  Does not apply to global, repeatable, or WEATHER sounds.
dsurround.config.thunderStorms.tooltip: Options for defining how Dynamic Surroundings will modify thunder and lightning effects
dsurround.config.thunderStorms.replaceTh: Enables replacement of thunder sounds with Dynamic Surroundings' version
dsurround.config.blockEffects.blockEffec: Distance that will be scanned when generating block effects
dsurround.config.blockEffects.steamColum: Enable/disable steam column effect when liquids hit hot sources
dsurround.config.blockEffects.flameJetEn: Enable/disable flame jets produced over lava and nether wart
dsurround.config.blockEffects.waterfalls: Enable/disable waterfall effect from flowing water
dsurround.config.blockEffects.enableWate: Enable/disable waterfall sound effects.  Particle effects will still happen if enabled.  If you want to turn off waterfalls use the option §eEnable Waterfall Sounds§r.
Enable/disable particles from waterfalls.  Sound effects will still happen if enabled.  If you want to turn off waterfalls use the option §eEnable Waterfall Sounds§r.
dsurround.config.blockEffects.waterRippl: The style of water ripple to render when a drop hits a fluid.  Commonly happens with rainfall and water splashes.
dsurround.config.entityEffects.entityEff: The maximum range at which entity special effects are applied.  Keep in mind that sound and particle effects have their own respective ranges within the Minecraft game engine.
dsurround.config.entityEffects.enableBre: Enable/disable breath effect in cold biomes
dsurround.config.entityEffects.enableSwi: Enable/disable item swing sound effects from players and mobs
dsurround.config.entityEffects.enableBru: Enable/disable sound effect when walking through dense brush
dsurround.config.footstepAccents.tooltip: Configuration options for footstep accent effects
dsurround.config.footstepAccents.enableA: Enable/disable accents for armor that is worn
dsurround.config.footstepAccents.enableW: Enable/disable accents for when it is raining or blocks are waterlogged
dsurround.config.footstepAccents.enableF: Enable/disable accents for when the player is walking on squeaky blocks
dsurround.config.particleTweaks.tooltip: Configuration options for tweaking particle behavior
dsurround.config.particleTweaks.suppress: Enable/disable suppressing the current players potion particles when in first person view
Enable/disable showing of projectile particle trails on crtical strikes
Configuration options for the compass and clock overlay
Enable/disable display of the clock display when holding a clock item
Enable/disable display of the compass display when holding a compass item
Scales the display by the specified amount
dsurround.config.enhancedSounds.tooltip: Configuration options for enhanced sound processing (reverb, etc.)
dsurround.config.enhancedSounds.enableEn: Enable/disable enhanced sound processing (reverb, occlusion, etc)
dsurround.config.enhancedSounds.enableMo: Enable/disable on the fly conversion of stereo sounds to mono as needed.  This function will only be active when §eEnhanced Sound Processing§r is enabled.
dsurround.config.enhancedSounds.backgrou: Number of background threads to use for enhanced sound processing.  Do not arbitrarily change this value because it could impact performance.
dsurround.config.enhancedSounds.enableOc: Enable/disable sound occlusion processing (sound muffling behind blocks).  Enabling will cause additional processing by the background workers, and on lower end computer systems may cause performance issues.
dsurround.config.enhancedSounds.reverbRa: The number of rays to project from a sound location when calculating a reverb effect. Higher values increases CPU use and improves fidelity. Lower numbers reduce CPU and decreases fidelity.  This would be the primary setting to tweak when managing performance.
dsurround.config.enhancedSounds.reverbBo: The maximum number of reflections that will be made for a given reverb ray.  Higher values will increase CPU use and improves fidelity.  Lower numbers reduce CPU and decreases fidelity.
dsurround.config.enhancedSounds.reverbRa: Total distance, in blocks, that a ray will travel when calculating reverb. Higher values will increases CPU use and improves fidelity. Lower numbers reduce CPU and decreases fidelity.
dsurround.config.otherOptions.playRandom: Enable/disable playing random sound at the Minecraft finish loading to main screen
dsurround.text.soundconfig.caption: §bCaption:§r §o%1$s
dsurround.text.soundconfig.cull.help: Marking a sound as CULL will limit the play to a single instance over a short period of time, reducing the overall load of the sound engine as well as ears.  Will only apply to sounds played through the Minecraft sound engine.
dsurround.text.soundconfig.block.help: A sound marked as BLOCK will be prevented from playing.  Will only apply to sounds played through the Minecraft sound engine.
dsurround.text.soundconfig.play.help: Plays the sound with the volume scaled by the volume scaling factor.  Does not apply any sound category volume modifiers.
dsurround.text.soundconfig.volume.help: Set a volume scaling factor that gets applied when calculating the volume of a sound.  Increase to make quiet sounds louder; reduce to make loud sounds quieter.  x1.00 is normal volume.
